poem:
Title: The Shadow of Suffering 

In our shared spectrum of pain,
unseen we tread, quietly steadfast,
crimson-clad damsels, dancing on burning embers,
Embracing a torment as silent as dawn.
Pearls of survival, borne through uterine tears,
Endure the scandal of virginal chastity's wrath.
In the labyrinth of life, weaves a spectral thread,
Guiding the way to an oasis of dignity.
